meanings.definition: To respond or behave in a particular way in response to something.
meanings.sent1: She will react quickly when she hears the bell ring.
meanings.sent2: I react with excitement when I see my favorite dessert.
meanings.sent3: The cat will react by running away from the vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent4: His face will react with surprise when he sees the birthday cake.
meanings.sent5: Children often react with joy when they see snow for the first time.

meanings.sent1: The substances react to create a new compound.
meanings.sent2: When you mix vinegar and baking soda, they react to produce bubbles.
meanings.sent3: The experiment showed how the liquids react when combined.
meanings.sent4: The metals will react with the acid to form a salt.
meanings.sent5: The chemicals react violently when mixed together.

meanings.definition: To act in opposition to a force or influence.
meanings.sent1: The athlete's body will react to the impact of the fall.
meanings.sent2: Plants react by bending towards the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The car will react by swerving to avoid the obstacle.
meanings.sent4: The tree's branches react to the strong wind by bending.
meanings.sent5: The magnet will react to the opposing force by repelling.
